alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:26PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 723 PM EDT, Most of York County has recorded 2 to 3 inches of rain today and just about every stream in the region has risen and remains elevated. Locally heavy runoff will continue this evening and a few streams may rise to above bankfull. Lingering high water conditions and flooding of low-lying areas remains likely as well. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill, York, Southwest Charlotte, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Lesslie, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Mcconnells, Smyrna, Lake Wylie, Kings Mountain State Park, Carowinds, Catawba, Bethany, Edgemoor and Bullock Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Remember to be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding!
